relation: Great for these types of students

Ask your roommate lots and lots of questions before you move in. The personality test that they make you take might match you up with someone who's seemingly ok, but there's a ton of people that lie on them. I found out my first roommate wasn't at all who she said she was.
It's relatively cheap. None of the colleges back home even came close. It's a beautiful campus, the teachers are fantastic, and you can walk from one end of the campus to the other in 15 minutes.

The dorms are difficult to live in. It's hard adapting to the noise and a LOT of kids here act crazy. After a while it calms down though. Aside from that, I love Carbondale. It's beautiful and there are tons of things to do. The strip is right next to campus though, and it's nice being able to walk only ten minutes if you want to go out to eat or shop.

The classes I'm taking are informative, and we have a lot of good professors. I've only run into one whose teaching style was not effective. Just about every teacher is willing to help you, and there are so many staff members you can always find someone to help with your classes.
